intro: Pleurothallis chamensis, commonly known as the Cham's orchid, is a species of orchid native to the cloud forests of South America. It is a small, terrestrial orchid that typically grows in shaded, humid environments. The plant features delicate, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale yellow. It belongs to the Epidendroideae subfamily and is part of the vast Pleurothallis genus, which includes over 1,500 species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
